intro: Argythamnia laevis, commonly known as the smooth argythamnia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-green, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in the summer months. Argythamnia laevis is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
